name: Elemental Cataclysm
lore: An elemental cataclysm is a devastating convergence of all four elemental forces—earth, water, fire, and air—fused into a single rampaging entity of colossal proportions. These beings arise where the boundaries between the Elemental Planes rupture or overlap, unleashing a maelstrom of primal power. An elemental cataclysm devastates everything in its path, driven by raw elemental fury without thought or remorse.

traits.name: Cataclysmic Aura
traits.description: At the start of each of the cataclysm's turns, each creature within 30 feet of it must make a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. Roll a d4 to determine the damage type: 1, Bludgeoning; 2, Cold; 3, Fire; 4, Lightning.

traits.name: Elemental Resilience
traits.description: The cataclysm has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.description: The cataclysm deals double damage to objects and structures.

multiattack.description: The cataclysm makes two Elemental Strike attacks.

actions.name: Elemental Strike
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +13, reach 20 ft. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) Bludgeoning, Cold, Fire, or Lightning damage (cataclysm's choice).

damage.notes: Bludgeoning, Cold, Fire, or Lightning (cataclysm's choice)

actions.name: Elemental Tempest
actions.description: Each creature in a 30-foot-radius Sphere centered on the cataclysm must make a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 (12d6) damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. The cataclysm chooses the damage type: Bludgeoning, Cold, Fire, or Lightning.

damage.notes: Bludgeoning, Cold, Fire, or Lightning (cataclysm's choice)
